Lesley Nneka Arimah is the author of award winning What It Means When a Man Falls and other award winning stories including Light which won the Commonwealth Short Story for Africa and Skinned winner of the Caine Prize for African Writing
Chibundu Onuzo is the author of several works including The Spider King s Daughter Welcome to Lagos and Sankofa Her novel The Spider King s Daughter won a Betty Trask Award
The ancient art of tattooing or body art techniques have been a part of African culture for thousand years

Warsan Shire thought provoking poetry collection Teaching My Mother How to Give Birth is one of the bestselling poetry books Winner of Inaugural Brunel University African Poetry Prize amp is the first Young Poet Laureate for London
Yaa Gyasi is the award winning author of Homegoing Her novel Transcendent Kingdom was considered one of the best books of 2020 and shortlisted for the Women’s Prize for Fiction

Taiye Selasi is the author of the novel Ghana Must Go which was nominated for an NAACP Award and received favourable reviews from international publications including The Economist The Wall Street Journal and The New York Times

Maaza Mengiste is the author of widely acclaimed The Shadow King which was shortlisted for the 2020 Booker Prize Her novel Beneath the Lion’s Gaze was selected as one of the 10 best contemporary African books

Kangas or Lesos are a proud display of the Swahili culture Their imprints carry deeper strong meaning and messages and the designs serve as a cultural bridge between traditional and contemporary fashion

Noo Saro Wiwa is recognised as one of the world s 30 Travellers Her book Looking for Transwonderland Travels in Nigeria was considered one of the best travel books amp one of the best contemporary books on Africa

Nnedi Okorafor is an award winning author whose works include Zahrah the Windseeker the Binti Trilogy the Akata Series amp Who Fears Death She has written comics for Marvel including include Black Panther Long Live the King amp Wakanda Forever

Nadine Gordimer writer and anti apartheid activist won the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1991 She received many other accolades including Commonwealth Writers Prize the Anisfield Wolf Book Award and the Golden Plate Award

Kopano Matlwa is known for her novels Split Milk and Coconut Within her medical field she has also led community initiatives to support public health initiatives including the Ona Mtoto Wako campaign which was awarded the Aspen Idea Award

African women use headwraps as a fashion statement as well as a status symbol The Gele an elegant head piece originally worn by women from the Yoruba tribe is a popular fashion accessory whose use has spread beyond the borders of Nigeria

The Map of Love the bestselling novel by Ahdaf Soueif was shortlisted for amp has been translated into 21 languages selling millions of copies Her other works include In the Eye of the Sun I Think of You amp Stories of Ourselves

Marguerite Abouet is a leading light in Africa’s graphic novels sector Her debut graphic novel Aya won the Angoulême International Comics Festival Prize for First Comic Book in 2006 and has been made into a film Aya de Yopougon

The author Nadifa Mohamed won worldwide acclaim for her first novel Black Mamba Boy and which won the Betty Trask Prize for 1st novel and The Orchard of Lost Souls which won the Somerset Maugham Award

African women have unique prowess in weaving techniques and their work are celebrated in the traditional hand crafted baskets which have become a source of economic activity and a modern fashion statement

The African Charter on Maritime Security amp Safety amp Development in Africa offers practical guidance to member states to prevent terrorism piracy smuggling of migrants illegal fishing among other challenges that hamper the Blue Economy Read
The 2050 Africa Integrated Maritime Strategy aims to foster increased wealth creation from Africa’s oceans and seas by developing a blue economy in a secure and environmentally sustainable manner
The Africa Blue Economy Strategy focuses on areas such as Fisheries aquaculture shipping trade sustainable energy extractive minerals Environmental sustainability amp governance

Africa has a vantage geographical location being adjacent to some of the highly productive Oceanic and Sea environments such as the Atlantic Ocean Indian Ocean Red Sea and the Mediterranean Sea This presents abundant opportunities for sustainable blue economy opportunities

The Blue Economy offers an enormous opportunity for youth to become entrepreneurs and create employment They must be supported with practical training on the opportunities available in the marine sector and conducting sustainable and environmental friendly business

There s an urgent need to implement policies and regulations which promote the sustainable use of lakes oceans and sea resources by addressing challenges such illegal unregulated and unreported fishing marine pollution with plastic amp litter sea piracy amp climate change

Africa’s water bodies and wetlands offer significant economic opportunities such as fisheries aquaculture seabed mining offshore oil and gas energy mobilization shipping and tourism which can contribute significantly to Africa’s transformative

Africa has 38 coastal amp island states amp a coastline of over 47 000 km Africa’s lake zones are estimated to cover approx 240 000 sq km while its transboundary river basins cover 64 of the continent’s land area

Public Service and Administration shall protect its agents against all forms of threats insults harassment oraggression Article 16 African Charter on Values amp Principles of Public Service amp Administration

Article 17 Public Service Agents shall have the right within a coherent and harmonized pay system to a just and equitable remuneration which corresponds to their qualifications responsibilities performance and tenure
Article 14 “Public Service and Administration shall not encourage or perpetuate discrimination based on origin race gender disability religion ethnicity political opinion or any other consideration ”
Article 11 “Public Service Agents shall not occupy any position engage in transactions hold financial commercial material interest incompatible with their duties or responsibilities”

Public Service Agents shall declare their assets amp income at the beginning during and at the end of their service as prescribed in national laws amp regulations Article 13 African Charter on Values amp Principles of Public Service amp Administration

States shall enact laws and adopt strategies to fight corruption through the establishment of independent anti corruption institutions Article 12 African Charter on Values amp Principles of Public Service amp Administration

Public Service Agents shall on no account use their positions for political or personal gains In all circumstances they shall act with impartiality and loyalty Article 10 African Charter on Values amp Principles of Public Service amp Administration

Public Service Agents shall not solicit accept or receive directly or indirectly any payment gift donation or reward in kind or cash for services rendered Article 10 African Charter on Values amp Principles of Public Service amp Administration

Public Service Agents shall demonstrate integrity and respect all rules values and established codes of conduct in the performance of their duties Article 10 African Charter on Values amp Principles of Public Service amp Administration

Public Service Agents shall be required to perform their professional duties and show courtesy integrity and neutrality in dealing with users Article 9 African Charter on Values amp Principles of Public Service amp Administration

Public Service Agents shall demonstrate professionalism transparency and impartiality in the performance oftheir duties Article 9 African Charter on Values amp Principles of Public Service amp Administration

Public Service and Administration shall facilitate the introduction of modern and innovative procedures and systems for the delivery of its services Article 8 African Charter on Values amp Principles of Public Service amp Administration

Public services shall be delivered in the most effective efficient and economical manner consistent with the highest possible standards Article 7 African Charter on Values amp Principles of Public Service amp Administration

Public Service and Administration shall make available to users information on procedures and formalities pertaining to public service delivery Article 6 African Charter on Values amp Principles of Public Service amp Administration

Public Service shall be organised to ensure easy access to adequate services and shall be organised to ensure that services are delivered closer to users Article 5 African Charter on Values amp Principles of Public Service amp Administration

Public Service and Administration and its agents shall respect the human rights dignity and integrity of all users Article 4 African Charter on Values amp Principles of Public Service amp Administration
